etymology.description: 不(不) (bù, "not") + 知道(知道) (zhīdào, "know") = the state of not knowing.
etymology.interpretation: This phrase literally means 'not know' by combining 不(不) (bù, "not") and 知道(知道) (zhīdào, "know"). It is a direct and clear expression used to indicate the lack of knowledge about something.

examples.chinese: 我不知道答案(我不知道答案)。
他不知道去哪儿(他不知道去哪兒)，所以问别人(所以問別人)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù zhīdào qù nǎr, suǒyǐ wèn biérén。
examples.english: He doesn't know where to go, so he asks others.

examples.chinese: 我不知道他为何迟到(我不知道他為何遲到)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bù zhīdào tā wèi hé chí dào。
examples.english: I don't know why he is late.
